content: left ssk k1 k2tog row 6 p3 *k11 p3 repeat from * row 7 *sk2p yo k11 yo repeat from * until 3 sts left sk2p row 8 is the bind off row return to main instructions page 3 © 2010 mwaa knit obsession http //www ravelry com/designers/mwaa-knit ez 100th anniversary pi shawl camping half circle version page 7 notes for waves and droplets chart see main instructions page 3 for set-up row waves and droplets uses all stitches including border stitches 309 + 6 border stitches =315 total 315/9=35 repeats producing 34 waves plus the end stitches see chart the stitches inside the red lines in the chart make up the repeated part of the pattern the left part of the chart shows the stitches that occur at the very end of rs row 1 3 5 7 and the very beginning of ws row 2 4 6 row 8 is the bind off row return to main instructions page 3 waves and droplets for half-pi shawl 7 row a o o a 7 6 - - - - - - / \ o o o o o o / \ 5 4 - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - / \ o o o / \ 3 2 - - - - - - - v - - - - - - - / \ o / \ 1 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 9 stitch repeat symbol key / k2tog note knit mean knit and purl means purl \ ssk regardless of whether you are working the rs o yo or ws row in these charts the symbols do a sk2p sl 1 knitwise k2tog psso not change meaning depending on which row v p1 and k1 into the same yo you are working on they always mean the m m1 invisible make 1 same thing knit - purl © 2010 mwaa knit obsession http //www ravelry com/designers/mwaa-knit
